frameDefinitions: This frame describes the Impression which a Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an Audience.
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
An Entity is well-known among a wide range of people (in general or in a particular domain) for a particular Reason, which may be a behavior, characteristic, or some other associated item.

An Agent has attempted to achieve a Goal, and the actual outcome of the Agent's action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Agent's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
frameExamples: He had an extremely fragile self - <t><fex name='Impression'>image</fex></t>
Shakespeare was <t>famous</t> during his life because he performed in front of Queen Elizabeth I more than anyone else.
He <t>pulled</t> <t>off</t> his April Fool's Day prank by the barest of margins .
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity (a person, organization, product, or event) for which the <fen>Audience</fen> has an <fen>Impression</fen>.
A person or group of people who have an <fen>Impression</fen> of a <fen>Figure</fen>.
A generalized conception of a <fen>Figure</fen> presented to or shared by an <fen>Audience</fen>.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> which is widely known and recognized.
The behavior, attribute, or associated entities that provide the reason for the <fen>Entity</fen> being famous.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> is famous.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
A participant function in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails.
The place where an attempt succeeds or fails.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> projects a mysterious persona.
His <fex>public</fex> image is flawless
The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
This station is famous <fex>for the many ramen shacks surrounding it</fex>.
Certain people are well known <fex>only in North America</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> managed a feeble smile.
If you don't succeed <fex>in your subterfuge</fex>, then report back for further orders.
Benedikt was successful <fex>as a master brewer of beer</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he succeeded in putting the wig on the corpse.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
Katrina tested <fex>her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: as much as P8,000 to P15,000 ($150 to $300
Duterte Harry Has Been Dirty for a Long Time
the Journal of Current Southeast Asian Affairs
Department of Social Welfare and Development
